page.title: 11The Canal at Bettws,Newport
page.content: In{1792} permission was granted to build a{canal}from Newport to both Pontwewydd and Crumlin.The canal was 22 miles long and took 3 years to build.Only picks and shovels were used in its building.{Barges}transported iron and coal to Newport docks.The canal was at its busiest between 1800 and 1850.In 1852 the railway opened between Newport and Pontypool and the canal became derelict. In{1971 Gwasted lock,}Malpas was{ {restored}to working order and part of the canal and towpath cleaned.On our visit to the canal we saw the lock working.A crack has appeared in the lock wall recently and may prevent it being filled and emptied.Some parts of the canal are very pretty while other parts are dry and full of rubbish. Donna Jones 3B Fionna Gallimore 3B
